name: Thistledown
description:
Introduction

This canyon is on private property, and is closed. You could be subject to trespassing charges if you descend it.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Red tape

This canyon is on private property, and is closed. You could be subject to trespassing charges if you descend it.

Beta sites

  • Super Amazing Map : Thistletown

Trip reports and media

First known descent by Logan DeGrand, Kelton Manzanares, Tom Collins III, and Andrew Humphries. July 2016

Background

Most of the canyon is on private property. The owner wishes to develop the base of the canyon, pending a land swap with the Forest Service where he would exchange old mining claims near and above treeline for a small strip of land near Canyon Creek, where he will build a bridge (the land swap negotiations started in early 2016). Once done he plans to build two houses at the base, restore the Thistledown mill, create a mill and mine tour attraction, and build a zip line that will criss-cross the lower half of Thistledown Creek. Some road building work has already begun. Needless to say, he does not want people trespassing here, so this canyon is closed.
